data.event: In the 11th century AD, Pali was ruled by the Guhilas of Mewar.
In 1153 AD it was ruled by solanki or Chalukya Kumarpal and his feudatory Vahadadeva.
His devali with the inscription of 1273 AD was discovered 21 km north west of Pali.
Champavatas Rathores ruled Pali until 1761 AD when it became part of Jodhpur state.
